name: The Grand Del Mar

reviews.text: We love this place. It's our 4th time here, we have been here every thanksgiving in the past 3 years. It's a really special place here, amazing, amazing, amazing service and care. Even if they mess up, which rarley happens they will know how to make you feel better. The staff is super helpful and nice, spa is UNBELIVBLE and my kids loves the kids club here. I have only good things to say.
reviews.title: The perfact hotel, perfact service amazing rooms, great food and wonderful kids club. If you can afford it, it will be the best

reviews.text: I attended a two and a half day business meeting at the Grand Del Mar, but slept at the L'Auberge Del Mar, from Nov 13 - 16, 2012. I've already reviewed the L'Auberge. I can't speak to the rooms at the Grand Del Mar, but very well traveled Fortune 500 CEOs who attended the meeting said they were "over the top" in size and appointments. The GDM is inland, so it doesn't have that beach feel to it. In fact, although at first site it looks like a typical southern California resort with stucco and terracota mexican architecture, its stylings are much more Mediterranean/European. The food and service were outstanding. The on property restaurant, Addison, is phenomenal as is the resort's wine list. The golf course is very well maintained.
reviews.title: Atypical SoCal resort

reviews.text: Given I’m in the travel industry specializing in high end luxury travel and that I’m fortunate enough to stay in some incredible hotels and resorts in some amazing locations it takes quite a bit to wow me these days, but wow me they did.
reviews.title: WOW…no really, WOW!
The best hotel and best service ever
reviews.text: When I stay at a property I look for faults and shortcomings, not because I’m a negative individual, the opposite infact, but because when I recommend it I’m putting my reputation as a professional on the line, but I literally could not find fault in anything when it came to this property, the staff were all amazing, exceptionally well trained and provided that great balance between professional yet friendly service, the rooms and property in general were well decorated, there was ample privacy and the walls were thick enough to ensure you didn’t even know anyone else was staying at the property when you were in your room.

reviews.title: Outstanding in every detail
reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for any of their staff and they even went as far as providing a cold bottle of water and a towel at the front door when returning from a morning jog.

My stay here was fantastic! Service was top notch, always professional and courteous. Adult pool was quite relaxing and the pool was nicely heated! The rooms are massive!! I chose not to stay in a suite during this visit and that goodness because I could not believe the size of the normal rooms. The grounds are perfectly manicured and beautiful to wonder in. Feels like a 5 star Vegas resort in all the good ways and I would certainly stay here again and again!
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is by far "Grand"! My husband and I decided to "splurge" when we made this reservation and we spent 3 nights here the beginning of December 2012. Being the holidays, we were able to enjoy the holiday decorations, which were exquisite. The hotel and grounds are all maintained to the maximum degree, and the staff always called us by name. My husband golfed; the golf course one of the best, and I relaxed and had a couple of spa treatments. This resort is absolutely first class all the way, and very, very special, true luxury! It has an exclusive 5 star rating and it shows!
reviews.title: Amazing Property!

reviews.text: My wife and I spent the last three days of our honeymoon at The Grand Del Mar after seeing NY, Washington, Disneyland, LA and Vegas - and these three days were the best of the trip and one of the most enjoyable experiences of my life. Quite simply, if u didn't rate it 5/5 after staying there - your either incredibly fussy or extreamly hard to please. All the staff were courteous and polite - although we are not millionaires we were treated like guests and did not feel out of our league or our depth. Being from Australia, we wanted to see as much of the area as we could - and everything was top class. The golf course was magnificent to play, and all the added extras that the hotel provided - from chilled water on the course, to biscuits and cool lemonade in the foyer made the trip even more special. What really surprised my wife and I was every member of staff there called us by name, which was a lovely touch, and knowing we were on our honeymoon, when we checked out the front desk had organized a wedding gift for us. Now, back in beige, boring sydney whenever we light the beautiful sented candles we recieved I think of the wonderful time we had at the Grand Del Mar. I tell all my friends of it and we are saving to fly back to America just to have a week there again. Thank you Grand Del Mar, you made a newlywed couple feel incredibly special!!!! And compared to what you would pay in Australia for the same kind of experience and level of service incredibly reasonable in price!!!!
reviews.title: Stay here - don't hesitate - just BOOK NOW!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a truly fabulous hotel and a rare value at the five star level considering the size of the suites and the very reasonable price paid. Indeed, this was one of the very few luxury hotels we have been to where we felt we got excellent value for the cost.
reviews.title: The best hotel we've ever stayed at in years of traveling!!

reviews.text: The grounds are very well kept and beautiful. The suites are very large in general and our Palazzo suite was an enormous 1700+ square feet with two formal entrances, two bedrooms, three full baths, a kitchenette, an elaborate coffee/bar area, a very nicely furnished combination living/dining area and a huge patio with arched columns and great furniture. You have access to the lawn and pathways right from the patio, which was most appreciated since we had our dog with us. There were also plenty of walkways and lawns throughout the property so you could take a nice long walk with your dog if necessary.
reviews.title: Astounded! A true delight

reviews.text: This is talked about as being the best hotel in San Diego. I wouldn't describe it that way. Prior to this we stayed at Miami's brand new St Regis in Bal Harbour followed by the Beverly Hills Hotel in LA. The Grand Del Mar is streets ahead of both. I would describe this hotel as actually being one of the best hotels in the USA. I gather it is privately owned. All I can say is that the owners clearly know exactly what they want and how to get it. Their hotel is extraordinary. We are on day 2 of a 4 night visit staying on the first floor. My family love this hotel. I particularly appreciate the exceptional attention to detail. Restaurant Amaya food is the best we've had in the last 20 days during which we've been in the USA. We wished we had stuck to Amaya instead of going to Prada tonight, which looked good with ok service but food awful. In particular, I highly appreciate the oversized and very well spaced out dining tables at Amaya.....as well as the service. Also, the concierge team are co-ordinated exceptionally well. Everything is perfection. Quite honestly, I'm stunned. I try to discover hotels of this quality but rarely manage it as so few exist. The property is exquisite and brilliantly managed......with many exceptional staff all over the place. For instance bar manager Humberto is an absolute gem. Housekeeping is nothing short of best ever. This hotel is up there with hotels such as Sandy Lane in Barbados and Coworth Park in Ascot (the UK's best country house hotel). The owners clearly have made a huge effort and spared no expense to make every inch of the hotel into total perfection. They should be very proud of their creation. This is one of the best hotels in the USA.
reviews.title: Best hotel in San Diego?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from spending a few days at the Grand Del Mar. The hotel is very luxuarious and the rooms were awesome, very spacious with large a bathroom and the bed was most comfortable. We ate dinner twice at Amaya, its not the 5 star restaurant on the property but both the service and the food was excellent. We went for Golf and and course was very fun to play yet challenging especially the greens. Having the forecaddie included was helpful as well. Service everywhere on the property was excellent. Definitly worth a visiit
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We've been fortunate to come here a few times. Each time is just as good as the last. We have 2 small kids. This resort is great for families. The 3 salt water pools are great. There is even a little sand area and fire pits through out. There is an "adult" only pool but it's hidden away. Must be very nice. The rooms are plush and maintained nicely. There was plenty of space and if your lucky enough to get a room on the 1st floor then your room opens out into a nice courtyard. The service is excellent. When you walk in the halls, the staff will stop and step aside to greet you and let you pass. There much to explore in the resort. Hiking, which we haven't done yet. Pony rides were great and arranged during our stay. The explorers club was nice, with video games galore and art projects. Played frisbee in the atrium by the restaurant. On one stay we had dinner in the courtyard and the fire pit was lit. They had brought smores for us to do fireside. The Amaya had a nice breakfast buffet and the menu was nice as well. Nice view of the courtyard. A popular site for wedding ceremonies. Will be coming back again and again.
reviews.title: Great local hideaway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed 4 great days and nights at the Grand Del Mar. I thought the service was perfect. The hotel is beautiful. The hotel has a good gym, outdoor pool, and golf course on site. We were pleasantly surprised when the hotel accommodated our group's request for a place to watch college football. Club M provided the perfect location to watch the Tide crumble. Aside from that pedestrian pursuit, the hotel is a luxury resort in every way.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and Awesome Service

reviews.text: So many positive review for this resort... I went in with high expectations but was pleasantly surprised that it exceeded it. Service was so receptive. Even the house keeping staff and the engineers that past by the halls were extremely friendly. Resort was beautiful. Pool area and the hiking was superb. Each room was tastefully decorated neo classic. The restaurants on the property was superb with Addison being way over the top in food and service. If you're an avid golfer, this is it. If you just want a place to escape this is it. I can't help but to make comparisons with my recent experiences at the st Regis and Mandarin Oriental. They were so bland compared to the GDM. Thanks so much for wonderful 3 day stay.
reviews.title: Excellent and then some

reviews.text: Grand Del Mar is one of the most elegant and beautiful hotels my husband and I have stayed in ever! We were there for just a few days which is really a shame since the hotel and it's surroundings are stunning.
reviews.title: Grand is correct for Grand Del Mar!

reviews.text: Staff is very personable but stays out of your way until needed!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, outstanding service, food could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food and wine was excellent at restaurants and it really has all you need to just stay and relax without getting out-including an exceptional golf course to play and view.
reviews.title: Grand-iose!

reviews.text: We have already sent friends to stay there and they rave about it as much as we do!
reviews.title: absolutely superb in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the weekend and had a lovely time. The resort has something for everyone, we enjoyed yoga classes, tennis, trail rides, spa and both restaurants. The spa was fine, but I've definitely seen bigger and better appointed ones - my deep tissue massage was wonderful. The pool was wonderful and my nieces appreciated having it practically to themselves, something I understand is very unusual as this hotel is normally at capacity. The grounds are spectacular and well appointed, I highly recommend the trail ride which provides a unique view of the property ($130 for 1 hour). The kids loved playing tennis, and rackets were provided free of charge. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful, often anticipating needs before we even thought of them - they've definitely been trained in the Apple school of thought and it shows. The food was very underwhelming - a lack of any quality ingredients (nothing local or organic). Addison had a few quality ingredients, but for the price I expected a lot more. Amara was adequate but nothing was particularly impressive. Room service was late both mornings and practically inedible - total waste of money. For the money, I would probably opt for The Resort at Pelican Hill which is 1 hour north in Laguna Beach.
reviews.title: Weekend getaway

aka: The Grand Del Mar Hotel San Diego
description: Serenely nestled amidst San Diego's Los Peñasquitos Canyon Preserve and a mere five miles from the Pacific coastline, The Grand Del Mar seamlessly combines the old-world charm of a Mediterranean estate with the modern luxury of an elegant resort. The result: California's only triple Five-Star destination and one of TripAdvisor's Top Five Luxury Hotels in the United States. Little wonder, given the sun-drenched climate, stunning natural beauty, championship golf course, one of the country's Top 30 spas, and irresistible dining - epitomized by Addison, Southern California's only Five-Star/Five Diamond restaurant, helmed by Relais and Chateaux Grand Chef William Bradley. From the completely relaxing to the downright invigorating, you'll find a variety of ways to fill your days (and nights) at The Grand Del Mar. Engage in a seasonal mixology class. Take a dip in one of four heated pools. Enjoy an afternoon hike or horseback ride amid the pristine nature preserve. Or, sip signature cocktails at the resort's enticing lounges - all before retreating to your thoughtfully appointed guestroom. Welcome to The Grand life - just east of the Pacific and slightly north of expectations.
